posts.title: Beginner JavaScript Tutorial: How to build your own Mad Libs game
posts.content:
When you are learning JavaScript, it is really important to continually practice your skills and build projects along the way. That is going to help you solidify your knowledge and make you a stronger developer. In this article, I will walk you through how to create your own Mad Libs using HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Mad Libs is a popular word game where you have an existing piece of text with blank spaces and you ty to fill in those blanks with verbs, nouns and adjectives. Usually the outcome produces some sort of wacky or funny result. **bold** ---

posts.title: Django Argon Theme Now supports all Django.contrib.AUTH links
posts.content:
Django Argon Theme, a popular open-source project, has been updated to fully cover the default Django Authentication links (registration included). The product is released under the MIT license on GitHub and the sources can be used in commercial projects or eLearning activities without any constraints. Thanks for reading!  **bold**

posts.title: Master DevOps career and interview
posts.content:
DevOps is the intersection of Development and Operations, application release processes. When working on an application, the developer's main goal is to deliver the result to the end user, regardless of whether you use the Agile or Waterfall approach. The user must be able to use the app no matter what.DevOps means making this continuous delivery process faster with minimal errors and preventing bugs. So, DevOps provides high-quality and well-tested improvements delivered to users. **bold**

posts.title: Implementing a feature with Vanilla JavaScript
posts.content:
To be honest, I truly enjoy vanilla JS. Without a doubt, there are so many useful JavaScript frameworks that could save a lot of time. Yet, it's amazing what kind of things we can do with vanilla JavaScript: speech recognition, video recording, slider, carousel, etc. **bold**

posts.title: The Queue Data Strucure and How to Implement a Queue in Ruby
posts.content:
It is especially useful in threaded programming when information must be exchanged safely between multiple threads. Ruby's Queue has many methods that are more are less the same as Array. Unlike the array implementation from before, the Ruby Queue class is thread-safe and commonly used for coordinating work in multi-threaded programs. **bold**
